133762063,english,"Overall the game is amazing, graphics are top notch, gameplay smooth and fun and a lot of customisation for your character (such as classes, weapons, spells, etc) but you can also pretty much choose to be anything as long as you keep leveling. Story is good and the fact that you're being called ''maidenless'' at the beginning is funny. The only down side of the game unfortunately is the coop. It's pretty horrible because if you plan to play it with your mates, it's pretty hard. While I was doing a boss (The rider near the church at the beginning), I was almost killing the boss and dodged him extremely well and played good, however me and my mate got invaded by some high level player and pretty much healed the boss with half hp). Yes you heard it right, not only the invaders are not being targeted by the mobs, but they can also use the bosses to easily kill you. For a new player that's pretty discouraging for them to even make em try to touch coop, considering that's the best part about a multiplayer, especially a souls game. If you plan on playing this on coop, I'd suggest another game like Nioh 1 or 2. It's a souls game and it may not be the same style as this one but it has amazing coop and I highly recommend that one too. I was going to give Elden Ring a 10/10 but due to this coop problem which is honestly pretty unfortunate, I give it an 8/10. Worth the shot.",2023-02-27 21:39:30,True,0,0,True,False,False,81,3,1825,1825,388,2023-03-06 18:48:03

I enjoyed all other fromsoft games. To me the open world is and the unoriginal bosses is what ruined it. 95% of the bosses are really easy they are even easier than dark souls 2 bosses. Even Malenia which people claim is harder than bosses like Nameless king, Artorius, Midir ect isnâ€™t as tough as people make it out to be. Also as you mentioned in the video the reused bosses, assets, and so movesets bothers me too. The open world really feels pointless and bland like in Ubisoft games. Souls like games works best as linear dungeon crawlers like the dark souls games. Or semi open world like sekiro. 133757919,english,"Most games are rollercoaster rides that guide you from one point to the next while trying to keep your attention through exposition that rarely amounts to anything more than popcorn. While there is nothing wrong with that and said games can provide entertainment, the overall experience tends to be forgettable.

Elden Ring takes the established Souls formula and puts it in a Zelda like open world. After 500+ hours I still find new stuff, uncover dialogue with NPCs, etc. While all the elements to keep you entertained for hours upon hours are there, there is also a lot more. It's like a digital painting, a work of art. From the colour palette to the music. Even though the world is a bleak, surreal and dreamy nothing feels out of place. Every item, NPC, piece of dialogue feels like it belongs there for a reason. This unfortunately isn't always true for the side content, which is one of drawbacks of an open world.

The obvious shortcomings of an open world game are easily overlooked by the overall experience that is present here. It makes the Souls formula accessible to a larger mainstream audience without handicapping the experience or the artistic narrative. Elden Ring will undoubtedly go down as a masterpiece along fondly remembered titles like Grim Fandango or Deus Ex.",2023-02-27 20:22:48,True,0,0,True,False,False,349,6,31119,2103,30141,2023-03-05 23:02:47

133744685,english,"This game simply shows how much love and hard work the devs have put in. I have played a lot of games and admired the craft put in them. But Elden Ring stands out from all of those. Initially when I started playing, seeing the map, I thought how can the world be so small. Little did I know that it was just a small part of the entire world. As I progressed through the game, I realized each area is distinct and very well made. The eerie feeling in dark dungeons and thinking that a strong enemy may sprung out of the dark any moment keeps you on your toes all the time. There are a lot of variations in enemies and the boss designs are of different level entirely.

I find most games that have a playtime of 10-20 hours are very detailed. But creating such a huge world and taking into account each and every detail is very impressive. Never did I encounter any bug as well. This game is well worth the money spent and even more.
I conclude that this is the best game I have ever played (keeping into mind RDR2 and KCD)",2023-02-27 16:15:38,True,5,0,True,False,False,220,23,16115,5639,15644,2023-02-28 11:28:32
133744342,english,"There is nothing more to add. Everything is already stated. This game is a solid 10/10 despite all it's imperfections.
Design is so fucking good, you visit places you couldn't even dream and face enemies straight from your nightmares.
I warn you, this game is very addictive and you can do things you never thought you'd do, like hugging girls.
Controls are a vast improvement compared to other souls games but still primitive, though that's on purpose.
Last, as always your biggest enemy is camera angles.",2023-02-27 16:08:44,True,0,0,False,False,False,177,4,22239,3300,20371,2023-03-06 21:55:31

column1: 133724633,english,"*Mostly* marking this ""not recommended"" because valve can't understand the concept of nuance.
Overall, it's a Soulsborne game, so I like it. However there are enough issues with it that any of the other Soulsborne games are just more fun.

undodgable attacks, hit boxes worse than DS1 (by some miraculous feat), being able to get hit by basic attacks while you're lying on the ground unable to move, and Fromsoft nerfing mimics to the point of them being basically useless are the main issues.

The world looks really great and getting to explore it for the first time is really nice, but that kinda wears off after the first play-through.",2023-02-27 08:23:00,False,3,0,True,False,False,242,29,5050,377,4806,2023-03-03 02:49:55

133722770,english,Decided to give the game a try because I genuinely wanted to know what it was like to play in a fantasy world like this. Did not disappoint. 133721749,english,"Look I get it, ya'll like getting your asses beat into submission millions of times and I should of known better when I was buying the game.  I am big into story and Its kind of hard to enjoy a story when I'm taking it up the rear every 5 seconds.  I don't have the time it would require to ""get good"" at this game or the patience.  I know its a Souls-like game, but it would be cool if there was a way to enjoy the story without having to suffer.  Like making an easier mode for casual gamers then having the intended experience for everyone else.",2023-02-27 06:54:22,False,3,0,True,False,False,105,32,243,0,243,2022-05-06 11:10:40

133720904,english,"Good god this game is a masterpiece. I have played it pretty much nonstop since I got it almost every free moment I have (I am writing this as I play). The only reason I wouldnt recommend it is its addicting. This is my first souls game and very rarely do I have issues with it.
Open world and a non-linear experience letting you go at your own pace

Bosses are usually pretty fun and unique, even ones that reoccur as normal enemies later as it is incredibly satisfying to fight something as a boss and come back and beat it to a pulp as a regular enemy
Bosses are rarely unfair and it usually feels like your fault for dying either by being under leveled or unskilled
Speaking of being underlevel, leveling and power leveling to make fights easier is completely viable and legitimate way to play
Tons of secrets to explore and find granting new rewards
Its a souls game, if you rage easy its not for you
Early game is brutal and hard and basically requires some grind or incredible skill
Camera can be buggy getting stuck and spinning with lock on
Lock on can fuck you as often as it helps you by randomly switching targets or body parts from slight mouse movements making you miss or get stuck
Attacking with colossal weapons is sluggish but also seems to eat inputs meaning mashing can make you commit to extra attacks and take damage

When a something DOES feel unfair it feels EXTREMELY UNFAIR. (For me it was putting a magma wyrm in a tiny arena where it can basically take up the entire stage with one move it likes to spam that leaves lingering magma)
Some puzzles are insanely complex, almost requiring a video making blind playthroughs hard

Jumping and falling on someone COUNTS AS AN ATTACK and will make them hostile or OUTRIGHT KILL some characters, which can lock you out of some quests and even endings, This can be fixed with a specific item at a specific place but the location is never revealed or explained until you randomly find it.
Scaling feels wonky, and some enemies will seem overly tanky despite being much weaker previously, or youll come back after a few levels and theyll be a joke

Overall though I would definitely recommend this game. I will be going for a second play through to go for other endings!",2023-02-27 06:29:38,True,0,0,True,False,False,87,4,5769,4054,4289,2023-03-07 05:01:54

133713846,english,This game is Space Ace for the 2020s.    Through trial and error figure out the combo of block, roll, little hit, big hit, roll, rinse repeat.  Finally beat bad guy.   Next screen, new bad guy.   Figure out new combo on up down left right.   Beat guy,  New screen, rinse repeat.
Sorry those that love this genre, but this is just lame.

I've been playing games for over 40 years, and this game reminds me of those crappy early games that were simple memorize the combo games, that threw in randomness to just make them unfair.    I've beaten many games on hard/insane level but this one takes the biscuit.
The only Souls-like game that actually has combat where you can plot your way through a mixed group of bad guys is Jedi Fallen order.

For all those who will call me a troll, answer this question.   Did you get through this game without dying 500+ times???   If not, then this game is pure luck.....The only people that can claim to be ""gud"" at this game are those that went all the way through without dying once.    The rest just spammed your way through.

The only thing that would make this game bearable is to be able to save it when I want to, like just before the locked door you know insta-death is waiting behind.........but Nooooooo, I have to die coz my perfectly timed counter just missed and I'm dead, so I have to wait 15 seconds for the reload then battle my way through the same axe fodder for 10 mins, to get back to the ""boss"" to then watch and learn their moves, oops, lag, missed roll or missed counter......dead......rinse repeat.   jeez.   Is this gaming?",2023-02-27 04:02:28,False,2,1,True,False,False,176,6,3454,3454,935,2023-03-07 05:42:24

133710916,english,"I mean the game is not bad. I have 100 hours in it BUT I do feel somewhat robbed. There is a lot to do in this game, even tough much of it is very frustrating. There is nothing which I would call exceptionally good about this game, but it mostly is always good to very good. Except in two regards. Graphics is really not that great. Its a large map, but for a AAA title its not good enough. But far far far worse is the Story/Storytelling in this game. I played 100h and I still dont know why we do any of the things we do. The player wants to become the elden lord, but why? What is the elden lord? Why is this world so dark? What is the erd tree? You can be extremely happy if you get a vague answer to any question in this game. The story writers were so lazy it ruined the game for me. I just really dont feel any motivation to play on, because why should I? It feels like doing the same all over again without any purpose. And I cant even imagine any excuse to writing such a horrednous story other than lazyness.",2023-02-27 03:00:08,False,3,0,False,False,False,114,11,6557,1763,6109,2023-03-07 01:27:04

133702772,english,I recommend this game based entirely on the fact it is a solid, well made game, that should be enjoyable for a few people, not for others.

But make no mistake, absolutely overrated, just a re-skinned dark souls with a few new features that were probably thought of by one of the designers while taking a shit or having a wank or something.
Same old gameplay, gets a bit stale, same shit different type of corn inside.

Personally for me the open world aspect only served to make the game more tedious than souls games usually are, I ended up getting ""souls fatigue"" about a quarter into the game, as the start of it is honestly quite dull overall.
Not actually sure why this got GOTY, isn't that award just a popularity contest nowadays anyway?

But other than that, sure yeah it's objectively fine I've no reason to not recommend it, have fun playing Dark souls 4 open world edition.",2023-02-27 00:10:42,True,0,0,False,False,False,121,22,1483,0,1483,2023-01-11 19:53:02

133700015,english,"Don't go after Margit early on if you're new to the game. He exists to say ""I'm going to be mean to you until you go explore the world."" Once you get past that hurdle, the game expands and there are a lot of interesting places to explore. Like Dark Souls 1, there's a definite point where things start feeling less polished, but I'm hoping we get a Elden Ring: Scholar of the First Sin equivalent to go over the rough patches.

133692640,english,"Incredible game. FromSoftware knows how to make a game. This is my second Souls game and I put it personally below Dark Souls: REMASTERED. I think FromSoftware did an admirable job making an expansive open world, but personally found it to fall into the same pitfalls as any other open world game: repetition, boring caves, etc. I think it is better done than most, but it would have been a much better experience if it was more like Bloodborne or Dark Souls.

My personal gripe is that despite the game rendering 21:9, it puts vertical black bars over the sides to force it to 16:9. I would beg FromSoftware to fix this. There is no reason to do this when the game obviously supports it. I have loaded into the game several times and not have the black bars on the screen and it is everything I wanted.
All of that said, I would still absolutely recommend the game. 9.5/10",2023-02-26 21:14:15,True,0,0,False,False,False,181,4,4874,58,4874,2023-02-26 21:05:48

133665783,english,"input lag, ridiculous delay on attacks from bosses, generally poor boss and enemy design (stupidly easy or annoyingly hard - nothing in between) and also area/level design is bad in the later parts of the game (boss spam and HP sponges).

basically, many of the old flaws and poor design decisions from other fromsoft games are here, and worse, and less of the good parts are here. if it was well polished and smaller in scope (to actually be able to pace it well and give each area and boss the care they needed) it could've been an amazing game.",2023-02-26 14:37:52,False,5,0,False,False,False,90,10,4769,0,4769,2022-12-18 17:07:33

133657604,english,"Whatever you wish to play as, your wish is granted. A blade mage? Check! there's blade magic. A pyromancer? Check! A cryomancer, necromancer? Yes! If you want to snipe with a bow, you can. Want to carve people up with a pair of knives? Want to tank with heavy armor, a big shield, and a 12 foot spear? Are you a parry master? Do you like laughing maniacally while you run into a pack of enemies and suicide bomb the whole group?
All of this can be done, but one thing that Elden Ring has the the Souls games don't: a Horse...i think...

There aren't many builds in this game that I haven't done by this point, but a cavalry build is one I haven't tried. It's tough to do, since the horse cannot go into dungeons, but it's something I still want to try.
This game has now become my most played game in my library. It was incredibly fun, and I still find things that I never knew existed. Worth every penny.
On such a high note, I do have to say this. Co-op is HOT TRASH!
I've always hated the summoning bs in the souls games.

GET SEAMLESS CO-OP IN NEXUS if you play with a friend. It will make your entire game play experience 10 times better because you don't have to deal with the whole crafting the item to summon your friend, summon your friend, wreck the boss or die, wash rinse repeat countless times.

133652239,english,"Elden Ring is a masterpiece of a video game. It has it all: intriguing story, stunning visuals, unique NPCs and best of all, incredible combat.

As an avid Bloodborne lover, good combat flow, and combat enjoyability is a must for me. One of the problems with most souls/soulslike games for me is when I beat a boss, I often feel a â€œugh thank god thatâ€™s over withâ€ feeling. I donâ€™t get that victorious hell-yeah moment, Iâ€™m just glad itâ€™s done and lowkey dreading the next boss that I come across. Elden Ring? Every boss fight is hard fought, but incredibly satisfying. The elation of taking down these gorgeously designed bosses is unlike anything Iâ€™ve ever experienced before with any video game. It feels good to win. So good that I find myself constantly coming back to try new builds and new ways to challenge myself.

If youâ€™re new to the souls genre, I almost want to recommend waiting to play this game till after you try something like Dark Souls. Elden Ring feels so vastly different, and superior in many quality-of-life ways that it feels almost unfair to compare it to most of its predecessors. With that being said, I canâ€™t emphasize enough that this game is a must try.",2023-02-26 10:43:57,True,0,0,True,False,False,70,1,12122,966,11363,2023-03-02 01:23:31

133645240,english,Note: This is not strictly a negative review, but the gameâ€™s overall design makes it hard for me to openly recommend it.

Elden Ring is an open world combat RPG, where battling with enemies is the center of everything. There is a huge world to explore where you find various items, that help your character you make in the beginning to become stronger statistically, but everything you find centers on your combat capability of course, since this is not an adventure game. Albeit this approach, the game offers some impressive vistas throughout the world you explore, somewhat curious NPCs that talk to you and most importantly challenges in the form of varying enemies and boss battles. There are many places you can visit, also underground, which all help you, at the end of the day, to become stronger by giving you more runes, that are basically a currency you buy levels with at checkpoints.
If one is familiar with the developerâ€™s, From Software, former titles, the risk reward mechanic is the same in here and the actual fighting mechanics are also the same as in Dark Souls games
column2: you lose your runes when you die, but can retrieve them from your death spot, but lose them completely if you die again before that, and the fighting is basically careful observing of enemies while dodging (by rolling endlessly) and blocking.

column1: The game is fun at the beginning, offering decent challenge, and at any point if you find the game too tough, which is likely, you can gain more levels by collecting runes for slaying enemies or simply exploring easier approachable areas. Since the game is very long in length due to the sheer size of the world, most players might wish to follow the main path straight to the end without much additional exploration, but alas, the gameâ€™s difficulty, even despite the help of a selectable phantom fighter (spirit ashes) who you can call in for help in tough spots, forces exploration to gain runes for the vast majority of players to overcome later tough enemies. This might not sound like an issue, since this applies to some other open world titles too, but the time it takes to explore to be strong enough is in tens of hours â€“ Iâ€™m not exaggerating.
While the beginning is fun and quite exciting, the more you play the more repetition kicks in, even if the areas around the map are visually different, but enemies repeat and so do bosses
column2: they use the same models. Even the overall quality of level design is better at the beginning, the Stormveil Castle being at least to me the most exciting place to see and explore, after that perhaps a few notable places existing in the game. This castle is at the very beginning and after that the quality slowly drops the further you get, endgame being very tough and a slog to get through, mostly due to some nasty bosses.

column1: The bosses are a big part of the studioâ€™s focus and they are admittedly often fun to fight, but in this game most bosses are annoyingly designed, scaling in damage too much from the very beginning till the end. This vast damage they tend to inflict in a single strike makes the game more a hectic rhythm based act to avoid the worst hits, while waiting patiently for an opening to strike pretty much freely when the enemy takes itâ€™s pause. I find this limiting character building wise, since Iâ€™m sure the game is extremely hard without putting many skill points on vitality (max health) to sustain more damage.

The bosses also have cheap moves and combos, which often rightfully makes you feel like you die an unexpected and unfair death, but this is thankfully mitigated by the phantom helper that can take hits from enemies instead of you and even slightly damage them, so you can heal up on the side, perhaps cast a spell or incantation and prepare to strike again. So even if boss design is most often not as great as in previous games from the studio, especially compared to Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice, occasionally being even bad, the phantom helper is there for you making some bosses actually pretty trivial, which is not a bad thing if you donâ€™t wish to be stuck on them in this - in my honest opinion - too long game.

I personally have explored almost everything in the world and Iâ€™m likely â€over leveledâ€, which would mean that in the main progression path Iâ€™m fighting enemies on a higher level than players usually are, but still, after playing so long, easily over 100 hours in fact, Iâ€™m still currently momentarily stuck at one mandatory very late game boss that, once again, has upped damage so that it can kill you in a short sweep of attacks. This fact is saddening to me, since the game has pretty fun exploration, the best yet character building in the studioâ€™s history, amusing places to discover, and of course the action is intuitive and most often entertaining, but yet the game is enough of a slog to get through at many points and too repetitive. If you decide or rather need to explore much because of the difficulty that can spike, the game starts undoubtedly to feel overall as following: cheap. It is a cheap game in the end with talent and quality at many places, but filler content and bad design all over the place. This game should have been shorter in my opinion, or at least easy enough to complete quicker going straight through the main path, but for me - and Iâ€™m not a noob mind you since I have completed Dark Souls 1 and 3 and Sekiro, Elden Ring is simply too tough to my taste to call it enjoyable.

As a side note, I might find the game so hard due to a faith build, meaning I use incantations in the game that are slow to cast in the heat of a battle, but this fact just tarnishes the game even more, because it truly doesnâ€™t allow too much freedom in building the character if you want to excel as care free as possible - which you want, trust me.

Now you might find this game fun and most players looking for combatting challenge will do at the beginning for a long while, but I label this review as negative due to the overall quality throughout the experience and the too cheap and frustrating challenge you will face eventually, no matter how good you are. If you are good, you will overcome the challenge, perhaps even quickly, but I doubt many of the fights are that fun in any case, unlike in Dark Souls 3 for example, where the game is thoroughly quite carefully designed, albeit unforgiving.

Consider this game if you are ready to face this disappointment Iâ€™m feeling here and in the case you are a fan of the studioâ€™s previous work, but for many, you should think twice, remembering that this game is far from GOTY material like some might claim, because the quality is so varying. I think sound design and graphics should be better as well to call this a GOTY, since the tech is like a mix of last-gen and current-gen, leaning more on the last-gen.

Lastly about the mentioned technical side: The game runs decent enough if you have strong single core CPU performance and my RX 5700 XT plays it almost always at 60 FPS on max settings at 1440p, which the game is unfortunately capped at, but this hasnâ€™t bothered me mentionably. There are areas that are bound to drop the framerate below 60 FPS, somewhere around 40 â€“ 45, which is a slight annoyance, but those moments are rare. The gameâ€™s current version 1.08.1 is bug free, though itâ€™s worth to mention that I experienced one freeze-up.
Enjoy, suffer, be numbed, overcome, that is the formula of Elden Ring. Take this as you wish.",2023-02-26 08:22:39,False,1,0,False,False,False,152,55,7488,679,7346,2023-02-26 23:38:47

133632562,english,"I can safely say that this game is amazing in all of the aspects that a game can be amazing at. Gameplay, graphics, the environment that all of it takes place in, cut scenes, even the small bits of lore that I managed to gather as I played these 80 hours, mobs/bosses visual and combat designs, the learning curve that you had to go through with each and every ""creature"" type so you can defeat it effectively and there are many other more features that I probably didn't even take advantage of, because to be honest 80 hours is not enough to get a taste of everything this game has to offer. But I have one objection to make...only one. Leonine Misbegotten. That piece of shit. That son of a bitch. That fucking pain in the ass of a boss. Don't get me wrong he is well designed and all, but I don't think I have ever hated a boss more than that ginger lion lookin' trash. All I hope for him is to choke on a huge bag of dicks daily from dawn to midnight. I fought Malenia and defeated her in 2 tries. I killed Placidusax first try. Rykard? Fucking owned his ass in the first phase and I even forgot to have the big sword equipped. And then the second try I didn't even bother to dodge. DEAD. But that asshole, he is something else. It took me about 6 to 7 hours to kill him. And once I did I was thrilled. I was over the fucking Moon. Now please imagine my surprise when I FOUND HIM AGAIN RIGHT BEFORE RADHAN, AND HE HAD COMPANY A FUCKING ANNOYING BITCH ASS KNIGHT. SO IT WASN'T ENOUGH THAT I CANNOT KILL THE LEONIN BITCH BY HIMSELF BECAUSE MY BRAIN CANNOT COMPREHEND HIS MOVE SET, HE HAD AN ANNOYING IDIOT KNIGHT WITH A BIG SWORD AND A POINTY SHIELD TO STICK IT UP MY ASS. AND THE I FOUND HIM AGAIN IN LEYNDELL 2 TIMES. AND THEN AGAIN RIGHT BEFORE LORETTA AT ELPHAEL. AND THERE ARE PROBABLY MANY MORE OTHER LOCATIONS WHERE THAT PIECE OF SHIT IS HIDING HOPING TO FIND ME!!!
Anyway rant over. 10/10 game I totally recommend it",2023-02-26 04:00:28,True,0,0,False,False,False,163,12,4828,1820,4828,2023-02-25 20:47:19
